title: @Riot So are the rest of the Championship skins going to be made available again in 5.18?

embed.description: Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers! Manage your expectations accordingly. )

body: So, as seen in the link, Championship Kalista is coming during the Worlds patch, and so this thought randomly occurred. ARE THE REST OF THEM COMING BACK? In one of  the articles @KateyKhaos said that there would be a Championship vs Victorious matchup, so what better opportunity to re-release all of the legacy Championship skin and get this show on the road!

replies.body:
Hiya! 

To clarify here - The Championship v. Victorious comment was in regards to discussing the difference between the two lines and how you can obtain them. 

As mentioned by Mannysmoker, Championship Shyvana and Championship Thresh are legacy, which means it's likely they'll be returning to the store. Championship Riven is limited, and Hippalus [mentioned](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/H004gAPw-ecommerce-qa?comment=00350002), "Yes I think Championship Riven will come back someday. Most limited edition skins took four years to come back after release, and it's been two years for Riven so far." (We're nearing three this season.)
So is it possible for Judgement Kayle to come back? I would spend all the monies....
No, cause that was part of a special event in season 1 and you had to play a certain amount of games.
We currently don't have plans to bring her back. She was a gift given to players for playing x games in Season I.

So let me reply with another question, what qualifies a skin to be "limited edition" instead of just plain legacy? As far as i could remember the Championship Riven was just another legacy skin that everyone wanted released from the vault...

The difference between Legacy and Limited is Legacy skins are any skins that were made available temporarily and then retired to the "Legacy Vault." They may be available for normal purchase again at a later date.  Limited Edition skins are skins that were temporarily available  during seasonal or special events (either in store or at an event)  then removed once the event was over. 

For example, PAX Sivir is Limited - it was for a special event (PAX), and we don't have plans to bring her back. Victorious skins would also be considered Limited skins because they were handed out for an event, and aren't available again once the season is over

However, as mentioned above there is a possibility of bringing Championship Riven back.

I guess i didn't word my question correctly, the Championship skins were first released during their own Worlds patch, just like Kalista in 5.18. So if skins for events are marked as "Limited", why is Championship Riven the only "limited" and Thresh's and Shyvana's marked at "Legacy"? 

Please don't take any offence to this, I really do look up to you guys and all that, but still there are inconsistencies like this that don't make much sense.

I don't have the answer as to why Championship Riven was Limited (this was way before my time at Riot), but I can give a bit of context into why we've moved to Legacy skins. 

The [big shift](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/store/sales/plan-vintage-limited-edition-skins) was when we moved from some of the holiday skins over from Limited to Legacy. We felt that generally speaking, skins are about peersonalization and fun, not exclusivity. Making skins Legacy meant that they'd be available for a while, go into the Legacy Vault, and then be brought back periodically. 

If a skin such as Championship Riven was brought back, we'd likely treat it similarly to the Limited -> Legacy switch I'd mentioned above.

Okay, that's starting to make a bit more sense! Thank you much and GL on the Plat train to Diamond!

Glad I could help! 

Okay, I won't lie, I laughed harder than I should at that. xD Thanks, I'm not sure I'll make it, but I'm not giving up just yet. :P

Shoot for the moon! Even if you miss you'll be forever lost drifting among the stars like *coughsatancough*  I MEAN Teemo yea definitely Teemo.

You should make Victorious skins from previous seasons available in the store as like a 750 skin to people who make it to gold.

It would be a good way to expand their impact, keep the incentive for making gold that particular season (as they're free for players who make it to gold on that's skin's release season), and avoid locking out new players who fall in love with a given champ but weren't around when it was decided they would get the skin from being SOL.

They tried a poll in a survey for releasing Vict skins in the store and well no one went for it because they are meant to be a reward, so that won't even happen. If you were there you got the chance of getting it, if you weren't it's gone.  That's just how the game has been.

I don't think they should be in the store for everyone. Rather they get unlocked in the store once you reach gold, so they'd still be a reward for reaching gold.

The reward for reaching gold in a specific season would be getting that season's skin for free.
Yea I agree, I've never once made it to gold or higher, and so I'd like to be able to have access to those skins once i reach gold, because I will reach gold.
